column4: Hello all.  I have a question.  But first I have to say that I'm using ubuntu on a macbook pro using livecd.  That's pretty  c ool
My  question is I'm having problem installing ubuntu on a dell desktop.
It get's to the part that plays the music and the  monitor doesn't show anything
It's like it's not getting a signal
what model of Dell
Not sure offhand, I know it's not horribly old.  It plays Halflife 2 and  such.
at the start install menu.. try F6 then noapic    , also burning slow helps, or use the alternate-text installer
I ask as I have a few around, c610 and c640 d600
what do you mean by burning slow?
when you burn the *.iso.. burn at slowest speed possible
The dell should say on the bottom what model it is
Yeah, I'm not  there anymore, it's a friends computer.
I want to say it's an optiplex
try those suggestions...  so not a lappy...
I also have a gx240 optiplx.. use F6 and noapic
Nah, desktop.  :)
I'll try  noapic and I'll also Burn a copy  of the text installer if I have to.
At least you know it will work with the onboard video or the nvidia plug in as well
Yeah, well I think the MBP uses ATI.
I thought onboard was intel.. but either way optiplex did work with the option.. You can create a spare partition for data then install to unallocated space.
I'm not sure I do know that I ahve the ati drivers in windows.
it will e fine
Yeah, he has two internal disks and one external, he's going to move data from the intern als to the external and then install linux on the main drive in a new partition.
Thanks for the help, gonna go back into OS X land.  :)
